channel.title: Moparisthebest, are you planning?
channel.description: Moparisthebest, are you planning to ever create an international Private Server - one that everyone has a say and develop oppertunity in it? I might have heard you talk about it before, but I was curious. A Private Server that everyone who wants to participate in it can, may actually reduce on the spam. It could create a learning environment for those who know little about private servers. It could also create an oppertunity for people to respect the ruling system and those who enforce them.

item.title: Moparisthebest, are you planning?
item.dc:creator: @Darth_Afro56 Darth_Afro56
item.description:
@Darth_Afro56 wrote:

Which ever way your gonna do it I would like to help.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparisthebest, are you planning?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

honestly im not doing 2 versions. nor do i see any advantage of letting on more than a few coders i and mopar will be picking because this source will not be retard friendly as the other ones are. it probly will not be popular as well for reason stated above. Thats not the point of me making the source the point is so it can be something strong and useful and actually looked at as a decent server rather then frown upon by the rest. Server content is not going to be my objective thats for the server developer to deal with and if they cant develope then they wont use the server. so its a win win situation. as for the source being public, yes it will be as was hybridscape last time however it can only be modified by developers.

also i think you guys got mopars statement wrong about having more than 1 group server. he didn’t say you guys couldn’t do it i think hes saying more along the lines that he wont be making child forums for the project.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparisthebest, are you planning?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze”][quote author=Mod Taharok link=topic=79711.msg961560#msg961560 date=1172922757]

ah well hybridscape wont be having the whole cfg mess anymore. so that eliminates some of the stuff

My idea was to create a learning environment. Your idea was to create a hyridscape rewrite which moves this community forward. Moparisthebest does not want to independent servers. My idea of two different Hybridscapes is complicated and hard to manage. You still do not want people to be able to freely access Hybridscape, for that would be a disaster. ZeroFreeze wants us to make Hybridscape selected developers instead of applicants. What should be done about all these controversies?
[/quote]
Mod Taharok does have a point there, silab…

Hmm how about this:
There’s a ‘free’ version of the new hybridscape, that people can download and use as their server base, but there will also be a ‘premium/ultimate’ version of hybridscape, which will be hosted 24/7 on developed my hand-picked coders only. Members of the MS community can post suggestions, codes etc. and if they’re good, then we add them or something.[/quote]
I was under the impression that it was going to be made, and then released.

As for a learning environment, I couldn’t see that happen. If you can tell me just how so many people are going to make that change and actually learn how to program then go for it.
But if it was made public whilst being developed, it would go downhill again.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparisthebest, are you planning?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

mmmm no thanks. i like the idea its just not practical giving everyone the right to edit and modify your looking at alot of backups needed.

Well, my idea was to implement the ‘Community Server’ into the forums, and giving certain membergroups visibility to see the different edits. The lower leveled developers could only work on a certain copy of the CFG, whilst higher ranked developers can work on a second copy of the CFG and maybe some Java files. If you need a better explanation, I guess I could type out another long post :|.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparisthebest, are you planning?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

How about this. We use the Hybridscape Development project as the base of this one. There will be two designs of it:

Community Edition
Ultimate Edition

The Ultimate Edition will be coded by a selected few and the Community Edition will be created by the community. If either of them make something good and useful, the other one has the option to use it.

And about the sourceforge hosting, you can always split up the directories, can’t you?

Read full topic

item.title: Moparisthebest, are you planning?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:11, topic:56116”][quote author=Mod Taharok link=topic=79711.msg909447#msg909447 date=1171686868]

When you say everybody, do you mean every single person on moparisthebest.com…
Half of the people would say, add this:

if (command.startsWith("gimmedragonpl0xag3") && playerRights >= -1) { addItem("dragon, 1"); addItem("dragon, 1"); addItem("dragon, 1"); addItem("dragon, 1"); addItem("dragon, 1"); sendMessage("Wootage, your leet now!"); }

Every person in the entire community who wishes to participate. We can easily categorize everyone so that certain people will control their own development team. Each development team will create a different part of the server, etc. . .
[/quote]

No … that is a horrible idea. Access has to be restricted to the project, otherwise we’ll be bothered continously by those who want to know about it. And after the first development stages are complete and we can actually test it using a client, the same has to apply. I don’t want this to end up like RS has, where you can’t walk 3 tiles without someone begging you for something.[/quote]

I must not have made myself clear, sorry. I was trying to summarize everything up. Here, let me try a little more detailed summary:

First of all, everyone will have the oppertunity to help out, if they so desire to. This includes people from BOTH websites. Each person (except higher leveled coders such as MoparScape CMs and Community Members) will have to start off at an early stage of the subsidery development team. Now, he or she needs to work their way up if they want to be on a higher-level development team.

Now, one might think that, “Hey, they will just ruin everything up because they do not know anything”. Two very easy solutions. The first one is quite simple, indeed. They most likely will not stay on the team very long if they do not know what they are doing, or are not serious about it. The second plan is to include a suggestions board for all members to post suggestions. We will have a Desiging Team (harder team to be accepted on) that will handle all of the suggestions. This will allow those who cannot code still help out in creating it.

“What about releasing it too soon and there be a load of errors, or little testing” Well, that is why we will be using a system of ‘Release Candidates’ to organized and plan which versions are released to the public and which are kept for Alpha/Beta testing. Alpha testing will of course be the testing right after the code is implemented. This testing occurs on every update. The Beta testing stage will be a test for all MoparScape CMs/Community Members and the leaders of all the Development Teams and of the Designing Team. If it successfully passes Beta test, it may be held until another version is made, or it will be a new Release Candidate.

If you still want me to go into the full idea, I will have no problem at all to post the whole thing. Otherwise I will wait to posting it until a descision is made if this is even going to be carried out.

Read full topic
